meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) for reburial or for medical investigation.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists were exhuming ancient remains from the burial site.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery workers were exhuming the coffin to move it to a different location.
meanings.sent3: The detective exhumed the body to solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: The researchers were exhuming the past to learn more about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The scientists were exhuming the buried secrets of history with each excavation.

meanings.definition: To bring to light, uncover, reveal.
meanings.sent1: The journalist was exhuming new evidence to expose the truth.
meanings.sent2: The documentary filmmaker was exhuming the hidden stories of the community.
meanings.sent3: The comedian exhumed a hilarious anecdote during the stand-up show.
meanings.sent4: The artist exhumed emotions through their powerful paintings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer exhumed the lost city from beneath the dense jungle.
